original_title: Profit-takings prior to pick-up at share market; indices rise
original_body_lines: CSE activities yesterday started with profit- takings but later began to pick up due to buying interest noted among select firms stemming from the low interest rate regime.
The All Share Price Index rose by 102.3 points while S and P SL20 rose by 8.4 points. Turnover stood at Rs 6.3 billion with seven crossings.

Those crossings were reported in Ceylon Hotels Corporation, where seven million shares crossed to the tune of Rs 325 million; its shares traded at Rs 48.50,DIMO 139,000 shares crossed to the tune of Rs 230 million; its shares traded at Rs 1645, Central Industries 150,000 shares crossed for Rs 30.6 million; its shares traded at Rs 204, Jetwing Symphony one million shares crossed to the tune of Rs 21.8 million; its shares sold at Rs 21.80, Sunshine Holdings 650,000 shares crossed for Rs 20.8 million; its shares traded at Rs 35, Commercial Bank 105,000 shares crossed to the tune of Rs 20.2 million; its shares sold at Rs 193 and HNB (Non- Voting) 67000 shares crossed for Rs 20 million; its shares traded at Rs 297.

In the retail market top seven companies that mainly contributed to the turnover were; Pickme Rs 247 million (1.7 million shares traded), HNB (Non- Voting) Rs 227 million (765,000 shares traded), Ceylon Cold Stores Rs 201 million (1.7 million shares traded), Sunshine Holdings Rs 197 million (6.1 million shares traded), Ceylon Hotels Corporation Rs 185 million (3.9 million shares traded), RIL Properties Rs 181 million (5.1 million shares traded) and Watawela Plantations Rs 158 million (3.6 million shares traded). During the day 154 million share volumes changed hands in 38000 transactions.

It is said that hotel sector counters actively participated at the floor, especially Ceylon Hotels Corporation, while the banking and financial sector also performed well, especially Commercial Bank and HNB.
Yesterday the rupee opened at Rs 302.55/70 to the US dollar, weaker from Rs 302.55/60 the previous day, while bond yields were broadly steady, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 15.12.2029 was quoted flat at 9.55/60 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2030 was quoted at 9.70/72 percent, up from 9.68/72 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.11.2033 was quoted at 10.70/80 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2034 was quoted at 10.77/84 percent.

The telegraphic transfer rates for the American dollar was 299.0000 buying, 306.0000 selling; the British pound was 400.3909 buying, and 411.7527 selling, and the euro was 348.1570 buying, 359.5202 selling.
